Your soul is OPEN-MINDED. Although you do have strong opinions and make decisions, you never make them without thinking first of not only everything that is, but those that may not be as well. This is a list of all of Lurlene McDaniel's novels. I've read almost every one of them. I would highly recommend them to absolutly anyone, especially teens. Garden of Angels A Time to Die Mourning Song Mother, Help Me Live Someone Dies, Someone Lives Sixteen and Dying Let Him Live The Legacy: Making Wishes Come True Please Don't Die She Died Too Young All the Days of Her Life A Season for Goodbye Reach for Tomorrow One Last Wish: Three Novels To Live Again I Want to Live No Time to Cry Six Months to Live So Much to Live For Dawn Rochelle: Four Novels For Better, For Worse, Forever Till Death Do Us Part Angels Watching Over Me Lifted Up by Angels Until Angels Close My Eyes Too Young to Die Goodbye Doesn't Mean Forever Somewhere Between Life and Death Time to Let Go Angel of Hope Angel of Mercy The Angels Trilogy Baby Alicia is Dying Don't Die, My Love The Girl Death Left Behind I'll Be Seeing You Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep Saving Jessica Starry, Starry Night When Happily Ever After Ends A Rose for Melinda How Do I Love Thee Telling Christina Goodbye My goal is to own every novel. I have some of them, but not nearly enough of them.

Tomorrow my parents are having a Memorial Day cookout. So today I'm working my ass off cleaning the house. It's not too bad except that right now I've been working on the bathroom, which means ive been trapped in a small room with a lotta chemicals.....feeling a little sick now. Well anyway....I wanna know what you all think of this place. If you know how to better it, please let me know, I could really use some help.

This is my first post ya'll. It seems as though everyone else is getting sites and I'm curious as to how well my blonde brain can handle this, woohoo! I'm obviously in the process of setting it up, so give me some feedback and let me know what I need to do and/or fix to make this sucker work. I'll probably go to James for help on this thing. Well off to figure out what i can do with this baby!

Well everyone is finally gone. I feel really drained and really alone. I hate feeling this way. No matter how many people I may be talking to or be around, I just feel so totally alone, lost in the world, fighting to find my way to the surface. I'm stuck in something that I'm not sure i can get out of, the worst part is that I cant specifically pick out what has me trapped.

We are having a Memorial Day picnic a day early. My house is filled with people. My uncle john brought this guy Josh.....I know I've seen him before, but still........OMG he is so fucking hot!!!! And he is bi! I love gay and bi guys, they are hot and cool. On the other hand today is also kinda a downer...people dont stick to their word. I had two friends tell me that they would call me today, one when he got up and the other when he got home. I haven't gotten any calls today. Oh well, I didn't really expect the first to call, he never does when he says he will. The other I did expect to call, but I'll live. Also I've had Nicky all day without anyone to really help me with him. Its a fight to find someone willing to take him so that I can go to the bathroom. Hell, my biggest help was Josh and he ain't even family.

Oh it's about time i got to this. The point of this site is mainly ranting. A way to get things out, not always bad either, sometimes you just gotta rant about all the goodness. If you'd like to become a writer on here to be able to get things out, let me know. I also have the tag board so we can all comunicate like one big happy family. This is a release site, no more games, no facades, just honest writting, with the occasional thing that makes no sense whatsoever. If you don't like that. Oh well!

Oh people really annoy me sometimes. First you got those that have to know everything that you are saying to another person. Then those that lie to get their way, those that lie to attempt not to hurt another. There are those that say one thing and then act entirely opposite of that. Then there are the "friends" that dont want anything to do with you over something so incredibly stupid. Ah, the people who think that they should kill themselves because of another person. Those that mess around with others feelings. The people that like to hurt others to make themselves feel better. And then just those that have been annoying me. If you are reading this and happen to fall in the catagories, I'm sorry. This doesn't even apply to some people. Just my way of getting out my frustration and anger at certain people that are annoying me lately without using names and offending people.

Bad poetry is what I write, It makes no sense to you, But its the only way, I'll get these things, Out of my head... No rhymes, no coordination, Just words on paper, With sentences, That are almost all the same length. ('cept for that one.) Bad poetry, Its my forte, I'd be nothing... without my, Bad poetry. sporadic and uneven... All that it is, Is crap wrapped in silk... But its all I got, The only way, To show all the world, What its like, To be me... To love like me, To be angry like me, To laugh like me, To be sad like me.

dead leaves and the dirty ground when I know you're not around shiny tops and soda pops when I hear your lips make a sound when I hear your lips make a sound thirty notes in the mailbox will tell ya that I'm coming home and I think I'm gonna stick around for a while so you're not alone for a while so you're not alone if you can hear a piano fall you can hear me coming down the hall if I can just hear your pretty voice I don't think I need to see at all don't think I need to see at all soft hair and a velvet tongue I wanna give ya what you give to me and every breath that is in your lungs is a tiny little gift to me is a tiny little gift to me I didn't feel so bad 'til the sun went down then I come home no one to wrap my arms around wrap my arms around well any man with a microphone can tell you what he loves the most and you know why you love at all if you're thinking of the holy ghost if you're thinking of the holy ghost

You know, its kinda funny how everything I do somehow involves you. I can never seem to get away from you, I doubt I can spend five minutes without thinking of you. I’m supposed to be doing Algebra, Researching Religion, Reading my books, but somehow you get into it, and once that happens its all over. You’re in my music, you’re in my movies, you’re in my classes, yet you feel so far away. I can hardly remember what it was like to be without you, even though it was only 3 months ago that I met you; and if I do find something to do that doesn’t have anything to do with you I lose interest in it, just doesn’t seem worth the while. But I really don’t mind it, its not a problem at all, unless I lose you. I’d be lost, thrown astray, I figure I’d find my way again though I think I’d give up on love… Because losing the person I love the most would tell me I’m not meant to love anyone… You’re my everything, and its ironic that the one time I used to be able to forget everything doing (Independent Study), has been taken up by thoughts of you… I love you

In my place, in my place, Were lines that I couldn't change, I was lost, oh yeah. I was lost, I was lost, Crossed lines I shouldn't have crossed, I was lost, oh yeah. Yeah, how long must you wait for it? Yeah, how long must you pay for it? Yeah, how long must you wait for it? For it... I was scared, I was scared, Tired and underprepared, But I'll wait for it. For it, ya... Singin' please, please, please, Come back come and sing to me, To me, me. Come on and sing it out, now, now. Come on and sing it out, to me, me. Come back and sing to me. In my place, in my place, Were lines that I couldn't change, I was lost, oh yeah. Oh yeah.

The past few days, my mind has wandered To places that have scared me I don't know why I thought that way I guess I needed a distraction A distraction from the feelings I have Feelings of confusion, of love lost, and loneliness Spurred by things I cannot fathom Something inside of me turned that confusion Into distrust, neglect, misjudgment My mind has wandered into these things And my heart had to drag it back out Thinking too much, instead of just being Just being in peace, in love, in charge In charge of my feelings, and where they lead me. Its funny to think, that the whole time, That I felt like things were wrong, I stilled lived for you, I went out I functioned on the basis that I loved you. So it goes to show me, my mind wasn't right, I guess it was bored, needed something to do Thing upon thing added up in my head And disillusioned I came to a conclusion That wasn't in the right, wasn't kosher But my heart carried me through the confusion And brought me where I'm supposed to be Right here with you, where I started Loving you like no other, loving you And not forgetting that I do.

I almost sabotaged myself today My world almost caved in My mind went on a tangent My music sent me a message I went with it for awhile Untill I realized I almost lost you there For a second I thought I didn't love you Then something kicked in And told me "You love that girl" Told me, "Do you realize who that is?" "That girl you love?" I saw your face and I sunk to the ground I changed the music Found something that reminded me Of my love for you Something that you showed me The second I heard it I fell in love all over again I never lost it in the first place I just lost sight of you

My heart... If it breaks now, The mending will be easy. If it breaks later, The scarring will be permanent. My mind... If it has its way, The mending will be easy. If it doesn't, The future is uncertain. My soul... If it wasn't in control, The mending would be easy. But since it is, I make the right decisions. My love... Was in jeopardy, Without anyone knowing. But it abides by my soul, So I don't make stupid decisions. My fingers... Type this poem, With a hidden meaning. But the real one is blatant, I love you, and I always will So long as you love me.

Missing you... Its not as hard as it used to be, Something in me has changed, I've begun to expect, That our plans won't work out. It used to hurt me so much, And for a time it turned to anger, But now its burlesque. I do feel quite lonely, And my heart yearns for you, But there is nothing I can do. So I put my feelings down, Because feeling so badly, Doesn't move us forward. Though it makes me want to give up, I stick it out for you, Because you are my love, And I'm willing to suffer now, As long as when later comes, You'll be there for me.

This was on my other blog, but I like it alot, so I figured I'd put it in my literature blog: I'm madly in love with you and there's nothing you can do I love you from top to bottom; inside and out You are the missing piece to my puzzle a puzzle rearranged in oh so many ways that it started to not make sense anymore then you came and set things right you made me a better person, you changed me life has purpose now, life has posture you mean the world to me baby and I'd give up mine if it meant being with you you are an undiscovered wisdom, a philosophy its own and I want to know more, more about anything, more about you you make me crazy girl, but its all alright as long as you love me too, what could go wrong? but thats what I'm supposed to think and feel being naive about the whole lot but sometimes being naive is the only thing you can do when the future drives you insane but am I really naive to think the way I do? one might think so, but I don't follow that line of reasoning I see my love as everlasting, so why can't we be that too? there's nothing that can stop us river, valley, mountain, ocean, they all mean nothing the connection we have doesn't see those things it looks past, beyond, not looking back, not caring for what we have is headstrong and lovely beautiful like the universe in all its wonder a thing without a name, only a description a description really too long to word just ineffable love that goes on and on forever in our hearts forever in our minds

I'm not into that kinda thing The only person I love Is down the street and always there Even if I can't get to her right away She’ll be there the next week Or day or minute or second In my heart or mind, and hers too Looking In My heart is a needy one And it’s being malnourished Not on purpose mind you It’s just the way things are I look at your picture And I smile inside But outside there is a straight face Because my heart yearns But my mind thinks It first thinks of the good times Because the heart told it to And then it thinks of oppression How you aren't allowed to be you And then I feel badly for you Though, my mind does wonder, I guess that isn't my business But my heart wants it to be For my heart also tends to be greedy And I'm in the middle of it all Outside looking in Virus The notes come from the instrument And enter my ear My mind organizes the information And stores it away A virus fools with the storage And relates the music Into things it wasn't meant to be Those things are memories And good ones at that But the virus knows my situation And ferments the memories into sadness My mind tries to sort it out And falsely claims victory Giving my emotions an unreasonable high But the virus knows better And cuts the legs out from under me Making me fall from my high place To the depression that has become the ground Until you come and pick me up again Stop Light The gear changes The car goes faster Red light comes on Car slows and stops Light changes Another one is near Red again Driver stops Starts to see more Through the fog Driver is tired Tired of slowing Tired of stopping All the lights are red And all he wants Is to get to the end Of the side street To pick up his girl To move on with life To grow up But people do things That turn on red lights And they don't realize it But he does And he wonders Should he take the chance? I wrote these awhile ago, around the end of December, it’s fun for me to look back on what I thought in those days because I’ve changed since then. 2004 is the year everything changed for me, it didn’t happen right away, it took a day to settle in, January 2nd 2004 is a day that will be imprinted on my mind forever. The day I met the love of my life. She was the thing that motivated me now to change the way I felt about life. And I thank/love her ever so deeply for that. My favorite one is "I Love You" because it makes me think of the girl I love. Even though I wrote the poem three days before I met her, I still think its about her, because (and its a lil freaky) that whole last part about 'you changed things...barged in...' is exactly what happened, maybe it was meant to be? Ah, who knows...

Well, after I'm not sure how long, I've decided to put this blog back on the map... I think I'm going to use it for my literature, that's the only thing I can come up with right now. The name doesn't quite fit anymore, but I don't really care, I guess it could kind of work in a way. I'm really desperate to find something to do that'll keep my mind off of things that are making feel crappy. We'll see how far I get with this...

I fall into my bed, wishing you were there. I wake up in the morning, wanting you next to me. I eat my breakfast, hoping I could make you some. I ride the bus to school, With an empty seat next to me. I reserve all this space for you, but you're not here to take it. It's not like you can anyway, But honestly if you could... ...would you want to?

I want to talk to you, I really really do, about god and love and all But the words never come to me I think all the day long, But when I see you, All thought escapes me, I hope you don't mind, Because I love you dearly, And I want to do is share my life with you, But when all I have is a few hours, Everything goes out the window, And I devote myself to you, Even if I don't speak it... I just want to be there with you.

The lord is my shepard, I shall not want; he makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters; he restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake. Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I fear no evil; for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me. Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of my enemies; thou anointest my head with oil, my cup overflows. Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life; and I shall dwell in the house of the lord for ever. Only reason I posted it was because I just came across it a minute ago as I was looking through my bible for no apparent reason and have decided it is my favorite verse in the bible. It shows me I have nothing to worry about as long as I have faith in the lord... Btw, I'm not preaching to my readers and I'm not trying to force anything on anyone either, I'm just voicing my beliefs, take of them what you will.

They say that every father has a dream for his family, the say that every mother has a dream for her family, and I could suppose that most everybody else has a dream for their future. I think that my dream is a fairly simple one. I want to be able to support my baby, and if she wills it, I want to be able to spend the rest of my life with her. I want to be able to put my past experiences to work for my family, I want to be able to teach people from what I've been through in my life (whether insignificant or not), I want my life to be put to use. I want to be able to take my baby to the places I've been and share new experiences with her, I want to go out west again and see everything from a new point of view. Basically, I want to make my baby happy, and if I could do that I wouldn't need to do anything else. I'd rather mean the world to one person than mean everything to the world. If she is happy, then I am happy. And when she isn't happy, I want to be right there with her supporting her, giving her someone to lean on. I suppose it'd sound a little strange to some people to be so wrapped up in one person, but I love her so dearly I can't imagine being anyother way. So whatever my future may hold, as long as it is with my baby, and I can support her and take her out to all the places that mean something to me, I can live with it. If she's not in my future, well, I think I know what I'd do, pretty much the same thigns I plan to do, just X out the Jaime parts and add the word recluse in... But for now I have my Jaime, and thats all that really matters, don't have to worry about a future without her. Will my dream come true? Well, thats up to my baby...

A feeling comes to me like a rolling steam train, Energy surges through my every nerve, My heart stops for a moment, And I haven't a care in the world, Feeling your lips pressed against mine, For the singular solitary moment, you take me to a higher place, where no one else ever could. In that moment I know I love you, and I couldn't love anyone else, Not the way I love you, You're all I've ever wished for. Its the moment I've been waiting for, To connect with someone like you, In all your beauty and grandeur, And I have to thank you for that.

When I look deep inside myself, Its good to know you're out there, So when finally I come out- I can be with something beautiful. The world can make me feel like crap, and it's not always the world's fault, But I'm glad you care anyways, You make me feel like things'll be okay. When I try to look deep inside of you, I stop myself before I get too far, because I'd rather hear it, coming from that comforting voice of yours. I'm thankful I met someone like you, I don't think anyone else could handle, the weird tendencies I get sometimes, but you seem to love me anyways. I woke up one day, And I couldn't find 'em. I just couldn't believe, They were gone. They rolled off the bed... Down the stairs... and out the door. Never to be found again. Where did they go? I do not know. They left me for dead, How could they do such a thing? I felt lonely wihtout them, So I put up poster's, All around the town. Old ladies gave weird stares, But I was too worried, To even care. Weeks went by with no word, I was really getting worried, Until one day, I got a postcard, "Welcome to Fiji" it said, "Wish you were here!" And on the back it read... "Well, not really, better off w/o you" I was in awe, my jaw dropped, How they learned to write, Is a mystery to me. I guess they were better off, I really don't know, But I do know one thing, I will always treasure, That postcard from Fiji. Weird? Ya. Don't ask me where it came from...

Take a tip from me, What you think is right, Is far from true, How you got that way, I don't know, I tried to help, But you shut me out, Never to listen again. So as you wander on this planet, Doing what you do, I'll be watching, Wishing you would have listened, Just one time.

The words in this thing, They hurt you deeply, They make you laugh, They perplex you. The words in this thing, They come from my head, They come from experience, They come out of inspiration. The words in this thing, They mean something else, Or maybe they don't, They can be confusing. The words in this thing, They show you love, They show you anguish, They show you something. The words in this thing, They can seem dumb, Or really intelligent, They drift from time to time. The words in this thing, Are just words, But they came from somewhere, So thats why they hurt, Or heal... Or love... The thing to know, Is that words don't and can't, Make a person who they are. And just because words are said, or written... or thought... You still have to see, That there is an emotion, Somewhere in there, No matter what the words say, Something else is there, and you have to find it, Somehow, someway, Try to look at the source.

I look at my bed, And I have no idea, What to think, It's only a bed, But there is something, Something else, I see a symbol in it, Somehow, someway, Something in my life, Is connected to that bed. I think of why I use it, Sometimes to hide from the world, Sometimes because I'm tired, Sometimes because I have to. I think of what happens on it, I cry on it, I sleep on it, I'm joyous on it, I'm in love on it. I can't figure it out. It's not a normal bed, And it sort of represents me, But there's something else to it, That I can't quite grasp. Maybe there's a lesson in that, That I shouldn't read into things, As much as I tend to sometimes. But then I wouldn't be me, and that bed wouldn't be here.

Time is going to take me, and pummel me to the ground. Time is going to grab me, and take me where I don't wanna go. Time is going to try me, and burden me to death. But time isn't going to take, The thing I care for the most. Time can't touch, The matters of the heart. Time can't drag my love through dirt, Like it can my face. Time can't beat my heart to a pulp, Like it can my body. Time can't erase that feeling I have, Like it can my memory. So I don't worry about time, Even though it changes me, Because time can't change, The thing I value most, Time will never take away, My love for you.

No matter what you think, I'm always going to love you. I have to admit, Like I have many times before, You are the greatest thing, To ever happen to me. No matter what you say, I'm always going to love you. I must say, Even though you don't agree, You are one of (if not the), most beautiful girls I have seen. No matter where you go, I'm always going to love you. I've always thought, Each and every day, I'm always going to be, Right there by your side. No matter what happens, I'm always going to love you, I'll always have the memory, Of that beautiful girl, That gave me the world.

If you want me to know you, Don't keep things from me. If you want me to love you, Don't put me in a corner. Because love doesn't hide, behind a mask. You're right to say, I wouldn't know, If you kept it from me. But I have to say, That if you did, I don't think you can easily say, That you love me. I want to hear, What you have to say, If it's good, then great; If it's bad, then fine; at least I know. I know you love me, So don't change now, Don't turn the light out on me. Because I'm no good to you, Unless I know. I'm just some other guy, Unless I know. You don't really need me, If you keep it from me, All you need is a friend. But I know you love me, and it is your choice, I just hope... You don't shut the door on me, Because I love you.

I stall... And stall... And stall... Until the digits on the clock, read: One triple zero. I try to suck up time, I start at Five I might watch a movie, or talk to my friends, But I'm growing impatient, Because that clock will not change. Seven rolls in 4 hours late. And time still crawls. I put in my game, And play it all night. Getting annoyed at those digits On my god-damn clock. It never turns to ten, Not when I want it. So I sit and wait, plotting all the while. Nine comes in slow. And by now I dunno, What I'm gonna do. So I grab a pad and pen, and write what I can, But I never get it right, 'Cause my mind is at ten. So I sit there and stare, At about nine-forty. Holding in my hand, My connection to you. A few minutes early, I dial all the digits, All the ones, nines, and fours, Hoping I can talk to you, Just once more. Doesn't quite flow... but w/e, I'm tired.

Sometimes I get selfish, And wish I could forget, Some of the things I know. So I can deny it ever happened, And never take responsibility. Sometimes I think, "What if I wasn't there?" Somehow my not knowing things, Might make things better for you. But I'm only being selfish, 'Cause I hurt so much for you. I wish I could make things good, I wish I could take you away, I wish I could keep you happy, and when I know I can't... I think I want to forget, That anything ever happened. Then I realize what I've thought, And straighten myself out. Because I never want to forget you, Good or bad, I need to have you. If I didn't I'd be a lesser person. You brought me love, You made my dreams come true, You gave me the world. That's something I don't want to forget, Even if I hurt so much, To know that you aren't happy, And to know I can't do anything, I still don't want to forget, That I love you. It'd be selfish of me, to think otherwise. All I need to know, is that "I love you."

But still I pray, and pray... and pray... Hoping for something, To shine down on you, and show you a better place.

The winds blow from the east Warmth comes from the west I can't walk this way anymore The weather has gotten harsh I can't say I didn't see it coming But I ignored it just as well The north is too frigid I've been there before The east hasn't done me good It's time for me to go south I'm not sure what I'll find So I think I'll take a detour Southwest sounds about right 'Cause at least I'll find warmth Travelling through this strange place But the more I move the more I learn If things go right I'll have a sound mind If they don't I'll be off somewhere again Looking for me... The storm clouds roll in, The air begins to chill, The first punch is thrown. Rain falls in an instant, Water weighs down your clothes, Everything moves in slow motion. Lightning strikes, An arrow through the heart, Red ooze on the ground, Washed away by the downpour. The power goes out, That smile of yours is gone. Thunder rages on and on, Words exchanged in anger, Like shots from a gun, Muffled by the sound of crackling, None of us wanted this. I fall to the ground, Throw my hands up, Pray for something better. Hail begins to fall, We realized what we've done, And it's hurt us both. The rain is all but gone. Wipe those tears away. Put your arms around me. Tell me you love me. The clouds fade away, I look for a rainbow, There is none to be found. But the sun moves across the sky, Radiating warmth upon the earth, Creating wisps of fog, To help us forget the pain, And move on to better things.

From my point of view forever is a weird thing, especially when it comes to relationships. At my age (16) I'm told that thinking about forever with someone is crazy and I really shouldn't think that way. But my mind-set is that if I'm going to invest such a huge amount of love into someone why is it impossible to think about forever? It's not like it hasn't happened before, my grandmother got hitched at 16. I'm not saying I'm about to propose at the age of 16, but I kinda would like to when I turn 18... But then again that all depends Jaime, so I'm thinking I have to wait awhile before I should even try because she wants to wait (or something to that effect anyway). Back to the point though, if you are truly, deeply in love with someone then why should you be barred from thinking about forever? Some people are scared about forever though, they think they are missing out on the rest of the world. I don't see it that way... When I think of it I think "Wow, I get to go out and do what I want to do and always be able to have this incredible person at my side." Just because you are together doesn't mean you have to settle down, it's not impossible to live a rich and experienced life while at the same time being young and hitched. My problem is that I think it's no use to be so in love with someone and then think, "Well, I'm not going to be with this person forever, there will be others," I suddenly lose the point of being in love. If you are in love with someone I think that the mind-set would be that you're going to be together forever... Otherwise it just seems like lust. And if it's lust then there is no use putting you're heart into it, you'll only end up hurting it. So what I'm trying to say is that if you are completely in love with someone then forever is a given (even if it doesn't last forever, that's why your heart breaks), and you shouldn't be frowned upon for think that way, as long as you know what love is. And if you think you are in love but your mind isn't set on forever, then you might want to look at your relationship and think about whether it is love or lust. Then again I'm not Dr. Phil and I could be wrong, it's all just opinion.

Normally, when someone sees a problem in a system, they recognize it and rid the system of the problem. But what happens when a person finds a problem within themselves? When they’ve finally gone through the agony of looking back at themselves and discover a problem, what do they do? I guess it would depend on the problem, and the person. For example, if someone were to figure out that they have a drug addiction then they might commit themselves to a rehab center, but if another person were to discover that they were compulsive liars, they might just continue on with their issues, possibly feeling guilty, but nonetheless continuing. Reason I bring it up is because I have my own problems, and I full well acknowledge them, but I haven’t changed every one of them. I used to have problems with abusing the internet for various reasons and I changed my ways, finally growing up and seeing that what I was doing was wrong and immoral. So in that instance I’ve changed. But in others, with a lot of my other problems such as: not speaking up, holding back emotions, not watching my words (such as “whatever”), and there are more I may touch on later. With the first, not speaking up, I have a strange dilemma with, well, it may not be strange but it is a dilemma either way. So far, it has not put a huge dent on my life, there have been times where if I had spoken up I may have succeeded in something I otherwise took the back seat in, or it just plain would have been better had I said something, or said it louder. There was one situation where I could have missed out on the love of my life, but due to the incredible friends I have been so graciously gifted with, all was not lost and I get to share my heart with the most incredible person in the world, something I thought might not ever happen. But other than the prior mention issues, I have not had huge consequences on my inability to speak up, therefore I have not tried to change it. Lately though I have been coming to the grave realization that if this does not change I will not be able to move into adult life correctly. I can run a business, and have it be the most successful one in the world, I’ve somewhat proven that in my journalism work, but the problem is getting there. In school, you can become acknowledged in basically one of two ways, through being loud about yourself, or by being recognized for diligence. My situation is the latter, I got where I am through what I have done, and it should work that way throughout the world, but unfortunately it does not. In the real world I have to network, talk to the right people, make the right connections, or else I’m going no where. If I can’t make contacts and just rely on my workmanship, I won’t get where I want to be. Sure people would recognize me for being a workhorse, but I’ll still be sitting at the bottom. Speaking up and voicing what I see and think along with my track record of good work is what will put me on top, I just have to learn to do it. I’m trying desperately to grow up and overcome this issue, and only time will tell whether or not I am able to face the change. With the second problem, holding back emotions, it’s been more urgent to overcome, but I have pretty much done so. There is a ‘but’ though, I have only been able to do it because of the person I’m in love with. I’ve always felt like I was sensitive, but I haven’t always shown it. Recently I have become more upfront about what it is I’m feeling, in some ways anyway, I can honestly say that I whole heartedly try not to hold back what it is I’m feeling when someone asks if there is something wrong with me. Sometimes though I still keep it to myself, maybe because it is for the better, or the situation isn’t right for expelling emotions, or I’m just being stoic. It’s not always good for me to hold back though, because it hurts others that might want to help and creates a whole other problem worse than what you started out with. I’m still unsure of what exactly I should do with this situation, but all I know is that I want to be more open and I’m trying to do so every new day. When it comes to watching my words, I need to do just that, watch them. Far too many times for my taste have I blurted out a ‘whatever’ when I completely did not mean to. I try to make use of an extensive vocabulary, but when I get tired it all just goes down hill. Especially when I’m full up on emotions, I don’t care what words I use, I just use them and only I know what I am saying, leaving the rest of the world out there hanging trying to figure out what it is I meant. And it usually turns out in ways I never meant it to. It’s something I continue to work on, I’m better than I used to be, but not perfect. So being a human being myself, I would guess that everyone else goes through the same process. You see a problem, see where it has hurt you, or where it hasn’t, and form that point you decide whether, subconsciously or otherwise, that you’re going to either change or leave yourself be. It would be easier if we could all just treat ourselves like a system and get rid of whatever problem we have, but as humans it is more difficult because we complicate the issues; it’s too hard for us to accept such sudden change. Point is we can change, it is in our nature, we just have to be able to acknowledge our problems and tackle them head on. **By writing this I am in no way asserting that I know something you all do not, I am simply going through a thought process and putting it in writing so that I may be able to look back on it and gather new knowledge from seeing my thoughts laid out in print form. My reasoning for posting this is that it takes a bit of a deeper look at myself than my other writing normally does, so therefore it ends up on Logos & Amor rather than elsewhere.

Well, I'm just about finished fiddling around with the template, I'm still looking for some extra little things to put into it. Stuff will probably accumulate over time. I think I may have gotten myself one writer, Katie. We'll see how things go. My game-plan for this blog, since I have two others (FlamingPinkFlamingo, which is about my personal life, and HereticLounge, which basically has all my literary crap on it), is to take different aspects of my life and write extensively about them, kinda like looking back on yourself and analyzing; for example, looking at a song I like and examining why it is it could possibly appeal to me. If that doesn't work out I have to find something else, I don't want to just have another FlamingPinkFlamingo, that would suck, so this blog will be personal, but from a different aspect. Also, it'll probably be updated on more of a weekly rather than daily basis, so that I can have a quality output. And I would certainly hope anybody who comes on board with me would kinda try and do the same thing. "United we stand, divided we fall," having conflicting genres of writing would just create chaos as to what exactly one would expect form the site, in short: I don't want to confuse the hell outta people and have them leave and never come back. I want my Jaime to write too, but I somehow doubt she will, maybe I could talk her into it, but then again, if she don't want to do it, she don't have to, I'm not going to force her into anything. I'll take other writers though, whomever is willing to write can go right on ahead with it. I suppose the next thing I will post will be a list of things about "James" o0o0o0o, interesting... not! Then I guess whenever Katie joins up she can fill out the same list about herself, just for starters. Ciao
I'm working on it, I swear!

First, you must learn to pronounce the city name. It is Bawl-a-mer, or Ball-tee-more, depending on if you live North or South of Route 40. Next, if your road map is more than a few weeks old, throw it out and buy a new one. If near Howard County and your map is one day old, it is already obsolete. On Monday, you don't wash your clothes, you warsh them. Before you eat a meal, you don't wash your hands, you warsh them in the zink with wudder. Forget the traffic rules you learned elsewhere. Baltimore has its own version of traffic rules... "Hold on and pray." There is no such thing as a dangerous high-speed chase in Baltimore. We all drive like that. All directions start with "The Beltway"...which has no beginning and no end, just one continuous loop that locals believe is somehow clarified by an "inner" and an "outer" designation, raising comparisons of the beltway being the big belly-button of the city. The morning rush hour is from 6 to 11. The evening rush hour is from 1 to 7. Friday's rush hour starts Thursday morning. If there is a ballgame at either stadium, there is no point inattempting to go anywhere south of downtown until the following day. If you actually stop at a yellow light, you will be rear-ended, cussed out and possibly shot. However, when you are the first one in line at a red light, count to five when the light turns green before proceeding to avoid being T-boned by all five of the drivers running the red light in cross-traffic. (However, if you don't go as soon as it turns green, you get the horn.) Precipitation causes an immediate 50 point drop in IQ in all otherdrivers on the road. Winter precipitation causes an immediate 100 point drop in IQ. Construction on I-97 is a way of life and a permanent form ofentertainment. Interesting that it's called "an Interstate," but runs only from the Beltway to Annapolis. Opening in 1992, it has been torn up and under re-construction ever since. All unexplained sights are explained by the phrase, "Oh, we're in GLIMBURNIE! (Glen Burnie)" If someone actually has their turn signal on, it is probably a factory defect. Car horns are actually "Road Rage" indicators. All old ladies with blue hair in Buicks have the right of way. Period. Even if they are in the left lane of I-97 oblivious to the fact that the speed limit is 65 and not 55. All roads mysteriously change their names as you cross intersections. A trip across town (north to south) will take a minimum of four hours, although the tunnel does have, on occasion, more than one lane open,but never on holiday weekends. The minimum acceptable speed on the Beltway is 85. Anything less isconsidered downright sissy. The Beltway is our daily version of NASCAR. The open lane for passing on all Maryland interstates is the far right lane because no self-respecting Maryland driver would ever be caught driving in the "slow" lane...no matter how slowly they are driving (see blue haired old ladies above). The far left lanes on all Maryland interstates are official "chat"lanes reserved for drivers who wish to talk on their cellphones. All mini-vans, particularly if filled with children, also have priority clearance to use the far left lane at whatever speed the driver feels most comfortable multi-tasking in. If it's 10 degrees, it's the Orioles' opening day. If it's 110 degrees,it's opening day at the Ravens Stadium. If the humidity is 98+ and the temperature is 98+, it's May, June, July, August, September, and sometimes October. If you go to a football game, pay the $75.00 to park in the "Ravens Lot." Parking elsewhere could cost up to $7,500 for damages, towing fees, parking tickets, etc. If some guy with a flag tries to get you to park in his yard during Preakness, run over him. It's probably not his yard, anyway.

Yea I know this is on two sites... As far as people go I think I’m a normal one. Introspective, and reclusive yes, but not tot the point where my world isn’t right. I have many skills that I’ve learned in school or taught my self such as writing, programming, and working with electronics and so on. Though I have these skills I’m missing out on one that many consider important: I am not the world’s greatest conversationalist. I have many people who can attest to that. But most of the people I know have been able to get past it and accept the fact that I’m one quiet bugger. When it comes to figuring out why I’m quiet I can come up with a couple of answers. For one, I normally never talk much unless I’m ecstatic, if I’m just content then I’m not worried about talking I’m just happy with what I’m doing at that moment. Two, I grew up with people who made me feel dumb when I talked (not my mother it was more my father and grandmother) so I keep to myself unless I’m absolutely sure of what I’m about to say… I’m kind of touchy about that. Three, I really feel like most people could give less than a crap about what I have to say so I just plain keep to myself. That’s not to say I don’t enjoy talking, I have as much fun socializing as any other average Joe/Jane does and with the right topic I could talk someone’s ear off, but I’m not going to be the one that starts the conversation, not usually anyway. And as I said before most people can deal with that, but some do have their problems. And it’s those few who have the greatest effect on me for some odd reason. It makes me feel like there is really something wrong with me and that I belong on pills like Prozac or Zoloft. Of course, that in turn makes me even more quiet, and makes me feel even more awkward around the person because now I feel like I’m expected to talk but I can’t come up with anything since I’m too worried about offending them. I’ve wondered whether or not some kind of prescription would help, but as my mother said, I am who I am because of the way I was raised and what I’ve been through, and to come out of it okay is a feat so if part of growing up caused me to be a bit quieter there’s no problem because I’ve excelled everywhere else in life. I wasn’t being conceited just a second ago, that’s what I was told, and I was conveying it to the reader. There are problems, obviously, associated with not speaking up all the time… I’ve lost a girlfriend because of it (not to say I really care anymore, but it happened), I’ve had familial trouble because of it, people have thought the wrong things about me because of it, and as I grow closer to being in the business world I could have trouble networking (but I have a rebuttal on that last part… and here it is: ) Though networking could be a problem I have noticed in my journalism experience that when it comes down to doing business my conservative speech helps out quite a bit. People realize that I cut out all the crap and get right down to what needs to be done, and then they look to me to help out, and I know one person in particular who could attest to it, she’s seen me balance the newspaper budget, schedule advance fundraisers, work with the Washington post, and get a group of people on track with what has to be done. But I’m guessing that my business attitude is detrimental to my personal life… which brings me to my next little thing. As far as my personal life goes… with my non-talkative nature I don’t really take too well to groups, I’m more of a person who is better with ‘intense’ one on one relationships. I do much better with just one person then I do with many… unless of course that person has made me uncomfortable, then all bets are off. And overall I just don’t feel the need to talk, I enjoy just being with people and sharing the experience… talking isn’t on the top of my to-do list. So in the end my quirk is bittersweet… sometimes a tad bitter than sweet, but hey, everyone’s got their issues, I’m sure I’m not the worst… even though people seem to make me feel that way some of the time. I’ll get back to ya in 84 years to tell ya whether how I acted was right or wrong, but by then it probably won’t matter that much now will it?
